intro: Joosia loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto joosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
